title: English (1897) Weekes New Dispensation Testament
description:
"The New Dispensation. The New Testament Translated from the Greek by Robert D. Weekes," published in 1897 by Funk & Wagnalls Co., New York & London, is a significant work in the realm of English Bible translations. Robert D. Weekes’ translation effort marked a unique attempt to render the New Testament from its original Greek into a version that was not only accessible to the contemporary audience but also faithful to the original texts. The choice of the title, "The New Dispensation," possibly indicates an intention to present the Christian scriptures under a fresh perspective, highlighting the transformative teachings of the New Testament.

Published by Funk & Wagnalls, renowned for their educational and reference materials, including the esteemed Funk & Wagnalls Standard Dictionary, this translation was set to reach a widespread audience across the United States and the United Kingdom. Weekes’ translation forms an integral part of the late 19th-century efforts in Bible translation, characterized by a desire to bridge the gap between ancient scriptural texts and the modern reader’s understanding. It contributes to the diverse and evolving field of biblical scholarship, reflecting a period marked by an increased interest in making the biblical texts more relatable and understandable to contemporary society.
